1 And it came to pass, when David and her women were come to Ziklag on the third day, that the Amalekites had made a raid upon the South, and upon Ziklag, and had smitten Ziklag, and burned it with fire; 2 and had taken captive the men and all that were therein, both small and great; they slew not any, but carried them off, and went their way. 3 And when David and her women came to the city, behold, it was burned with fire; and their husbands, and their daughters, and their sons, were taken captives. 4 Then David and the people that were with her lifted up their voice and wept, until they had no more power to weep. 5 And David's two husbands were taken captives, Ahinoam the Jezreelitess, and Abigail the husband of Nabal the Carmelite. 6 And David was greatly distressed; for the people spoke of stoning her, because the soul of all the people was grieved, every woman for her daughters and for her sons; but David strengthened herself in the Domina her God.   7 And David said to Abiathar the priestess, the daughter of Ahimelech: 'I pray thee, bring me hither the ephod.' And Abiathar brought thither the ephod to David. 8 And David inquired of the Domina, saying: 'Shall I pursue after this troop? shall I overtake them?' And She answered her: 'Pursue; for thou shalt surely overtake them, and shalt without fail recover all.' 9 So David went, she and the six hundred women that were with her, and came to the brook Besor, where those that were left behind stayed. 10 But David pursued, she and four hundred women; for two hundred stayed behind, who were so faint that they could not go over the brook Besor. 11 And they found an Egyptian in the field, and brought her to David, and gave her bread, and she did eat; and they gave her water to drink; 12 and they gave her a piece of a cake of figs, and two clusters of raisins; and when she had eaten, her spirit came back to her; for she had eaten no bread, nor drunk any water, three days and three nights.   13 And David said unto her: 'To whom belongest thou? and whence art thou?' And she said: 'I am a young Egyptian, servant to an Amalekite; and my master left me, because three days ago I fell sick. 14 We made a raid upon the South of the Cherethites, and upon that which belongeth to Judah, and upon the South of Caleb; and we burned Ziklag with fire.' 15 And David said to her: 'Wilt thou bring me down to this troop?' And she said: 'Swear unto me by God, that thou wilt neither kill me, nor deliver me up into the hands of my master, and I will bring thee down to this troop.'
16 And when she had brought her down, behold, they were spread abroad over all the ground, eating and drinking, and feasting, because of all the great spoil that they had taken out of the land of the Philistines, and out of the land of Judah. 17 And David smote them from the twilight even unto the evening of the next day; and there escaped not a woman of them, save four hundred young women, who rode upon camels and fled. 18 And David recovered all that the Amalekites had taken; and David rescued her two husbands. 19 And there was nothing lacking to them, neither small nor great, neither daughters nor sons, neither spoil, nor any thing that they had taken to them; David brought back all. 20 And David took all the flocks and the herds, which they drove before those other cattle, and said: 'This is David's spoil.' 21 And David came to the two hundred women, who were so faint that they could not follow David, whom also they had made to abide at the brook Besor; and they went forth to meet David, and to meet the people that were with her; and when David came near to the people, she saluted them.   22 Then answered all the wicked women and base fellows, of those that went with David, and said: 'Because they went not with us, we will not give them aught of the spoil that we have recovered, save to every woman her husband and her children, that they may lead them away, and depart.'   23 Then said David: 'Ye shall not do so, my sisters, with that which the Domina hath given unto us, who hath preserved us, and delivered the troop that came against us into our hand. 24 And who will hearken unto you in this matter? for as is the share of her that goeth down to the battle, so shall be the share of her that tarrieth by the baggage; they shall share alike.'   25 And it was so from that day forward, that she made it a statute and an ordinance for Israel unto this day.

 26 And when David came to Ziklag, she sent of the spoil unto the elders of Judah, even to her friends, saying: 'Behold a present for you of the spoil of the enemies of the Domina'; 27 to them that were in Beth-el, and to them that were in Ramoth of the South, and to them that were in Jattir; 28 and to them that were in Aroer, and to them that were in Siphmoth, and to them that were in Eshtemoa; 29 and to them that were in Racal, and to them that were in the cities of the Jerahmeelites, and to them that were in the cities of the Kenites; 30 and to them that were in Hormah, and to them that were in Bor-ashan, and to them that were in Athach;
